Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has water and is healthy, showing features like vibrant leaves and flowers.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water and is wilting or unhealthy, illustrating drooping leaves and browning edges.
The student can show the difference in the drawings clearly, with a healthy plant on one side and an unhealthy plant on the other.
The student can label the drawings to show which plant has water and which does not, using simple but correct labels such as 'Water' and 'No Water'.
The student can include basic details about the importance of water in the drawing, such as writing 'Water helps plants grow' in a clear manner.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally forget to label one of the plants, leading to an incomplete labelling of 'water' or 'no water' *(minor oversight)*.
The student might inconsistently depict the severity of plant wilting, with some parts of the drawing appearing less dramatic than intended *(uneven detail)*.
